title: Ticket #2269: Deprecated header usage in GCC 4.6.0
description:
Among the thousands of warnings in compiling Condor with gcc 4.6.0 (Fedora 15), there is the following about a deprecated header that causes a warning per CXX file.

I know Fedora 15 support isn't top-of-the-pile, but we might as well be thinking about the future! 

[ 89%] Building CXX object src/condor_dagman/CMakeFiles/condor_dagman.dir/job.cpp.o
In file included from /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.6.0/../../../../include/c++/4.6.0/ext/hash_map:61:0,
                 from /home/bbockelm/projects/fedpkg/condor/condor-7.6.0/src/classad/classad/classad_stl.h:30,
                 from /home/bbockelm/projects/fedpkg/condor/condor-7.6.0/src/classad/classad/classad.h:28,
                 from /home/bbockelm/projects/fedpkg/condor/condor-7.6.0/src/classad/classad/classad_distribution.h:25,
                 from /home/bbockelm/projects/fedpkg/condor/condor-7.6.0/src/condor_utils/compat_classad.h:27,
                 from /home/bbockelm/projects/fedpkg/condor/condor-7.6.0/src/condor_includes/condor_classad.h:30,
                 from /home/bbockelm/projects/fedpkg/condor/condor-7.6.0/src/condor_daemon_client/dc_transfer_queue.h:31,
                 from /home/bbockelm/projects/fedpkg/condor/condor-7.6.0/src/condor_schedd.V6/transfer_queue.h:26,
                 from /home/bbockelm/projects/fedpkg/condor/condor-7.6.0/src/condor_schedd.V6/transfer_queue.cpp:22:
/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.6.0/../../../../include/c++/4.6.0/backward/backward_warning.h:33:2: warning: #warning This file includes at least one deprecated or antiquated header which may be removed without further notice at a future date. Please use a non-deprecated interface with equivalent functionality instead. For a listing of replacement headers and interfaces, consult the file backward_warning.h. To disable this warning use -Wno-deprecated. [-Wcpp]
remarks:
Greg, any updates on this? Someone told me today that your patch for this was pulled due to some CREAM/BLAHP issue, but I wasn't quite sure what.

Can we at least pass "-Wno-deprecated" for now?

2011-Oct-25 20:16:43 by gthain:
So, the problem is that cream and blahp use the classads we build, but don't configure with cmake (or our cmake really). So, blahp and cream don't run our custom unordered_map feature detection code, and then all kinds of bad things happen. I talked it over with jfrey, who suggested that instead of doing ifdef HAS_TR1_UNORDERED_MAP, we have cmake emit the correct header file for classads.

Or, we could just drop all compilers that don't support TR1 for condor 7.8....
check_ins: 2011-Oct-30 12:12   Check-in [28049]: Switch classad to use tr1 hash tables #2269 Let's see if this works. Need to avoid cmake feature detection because this header is used outside of Condor in cream/blahp/etc., which don't build with cmake (By Greg Thain )
creator: bbockelm
